6. APPENDIX
a) Biographical Sketch

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Name Position Title Birthdate
OBERHAUSER, ANDRESF. [Associate Professor [11/25/61 |

Education:

Institution and Location Degree | Year [Fil

Univ. of Chile, Santiago, Chile BS. [1984 [Biology

Univ. of Chile, Santiago, Chile PhD. |1987 [Cell Physiology/Biophysics

1987-89 | Post-Doc,Cell Physiology
1989-95 | Post-Doe,Cell Physiology

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Research and Professi ixperiencs

1980-1987 Research Assistant, Faculty of Sciences, Univ. de Chile, Santiago.

1987 Visiting Professor, University of California, Los Angeles.

1987-1989 Postdoctoral Fellow at the Dept. of Physiology, Univ. of Pennsylvania,
Philadelphia. Gating mechanisms of ion channels,

1989-1995 Research Associate at the Dept. of Physiology, Mayo Clinic, Rochester.
Molecular mechanisms of exocytosis

1995-present Assistant Professor, Faculty of Sciences, Univ. de Chile, Santiago.

1995-present Associate Professor, Centro de Estudios Cientificos de Santiago.

 
  

1987 Regents of the Univ. de Chile Fellowship.
1986-1987 Doctoral Fellowship of the Centro de Estudios Cientificos de Santiago.

 

1988 Grass Foundation Fellowship.
Memberships:

Biophysical Society, Chilean Society for Cell Biology, LatinoAmerican Biophysical Society.

 

Invitations: | have been invited to give lectures (apart from Chile): at the Univ. of Alabama at
Birmingham (USA), Univ. of Texas at Galveston (USA), the Centro de Investigacion y de
Estudios Avanzados (Mexico), University of Seville (Spain), Max-Planck Institute at
Heidelberg and Goettingen (Germany), Instituto Venezolano de Investigaciones Cientificas
(Venezuela), Belo Horizonte (Brazil), Instituto de Investigaciones Bioquimicas de Bahia
Blanca (Argentina).

Extramural Peer Review Activities:
Research Grants: Reviewer for CONICYT (The Chilean Council for Science and
Technology), Scientific Journal Articles: J. Membrane Biol., News in Physiological
Sciences, Biophysical Jounal, FEBS letters.

Publications (* = most important publications: copies are enclosed)

1. Oberhauser, A., Alvarez, O., and Latorre, R. (1988). Activation by divalent cations of a
Ca*-activated K' channel from skeletal muscle membranes. J, Gen. Physiol. 92:67-86.

2. Suarez-Isla, B.A., Irribarra, V., Oberhauser, A., Larralde, L., Bull, R., Hidalgo, C., and
Jaimovich, E. (1988). Inositol (1,4,5)-trisphosphate activates a calcium channel in isolated
sarcoplasmic reticulum membranes. Biophys. J. 54:737-741.

summary: The author is an associate professor at the University of Chile. He is a member of the Chilean Society for Cell Biology and the LatinoAmerican Biophysical Society. The author has been invited to give lectures (apart from Chile) in the United States, Mexico, Germany, Brazil and Spain.
